title: How to Make Chocolate Drop Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place the butter and brown sugar in a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: Using a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar until the ingredients are light and fluffy. Your mixer should be set on medium speed.

steps.headline: Beat in the egg, milk, vanilla and cooled melted chocolate until the ingredients are just combined.
Combine the flour, baking soda and salt in a separate mixing bowl using a whisk.
Add 1/3 of the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing at low speed.
Add another third when the first portion of dry ingredients has been incorporated.
Continue adding the dry ingredients gradually until they are mixed into the wet ingredients, but do not overheat the dough.
Fold in the walnuts with a flat plastic spatula if you are using them.
Drop the cookies onto the baking sheet using either a cookie scoop or a tablespoon.
steps.description: Place the cookies 2” (5 centimeters) apart so that they have room to spread as they bake.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for 8 to 10 minutes until they are set.
Remove the baking sheet from the oven and cool the cookies on the stovetop for 2 minutes.
Use a spatula to move the cookies to wire racks to cool completely.
Beat the confectioner’s sugar, cocoa, butter, coffee and vanilla in clean mixing bowl.
steps.description: You can use either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment.

steps.headline: Use either a cheese spreader or a butter knife to spread frosting on the cooled cookies.
Serve the cookies with a glass of cold milk.

text: Bake the Cookies Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.  Place the butter and brown sugar in a large mixing bowl. Using a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar until the ingredients are light and fluffy. Your mixer should be set on medium speed. Beat in the egg, milk, vanilla and cooled melted chocolate until the ingredients are just combined.  Combine the flour, baking soda and salt in a separate mixing bowl using a whisk.  Add 1/3 of the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing at low speed.  Add another third when the first portion of dry ingredients has been incorporated.  Continue adding the dry ingredients gradually until they are mixed into the wet ingredients, but do not overheat the dough.  Fold in the walnuts with a flat plastic spatula if you are using them.  Drop the cookies onto the baking sheet using either a cookie scoop or a tablespoon. Place the cookies 2” (5 centimeters) apart so that they have room to spread as they bake. Bake the cookies for 8 to 10 minutes until they are set.  Remove the baking sheet from the oven and cool the cookies on the stovetop for 2 minutes.  Use a spatula to move the cookies to wire racks to cool completely.  Add the Frosting Beat the confectioner’s sugar, cocoa, butter, coffee and vanilla in clean mixing bowl. You can use either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. Use either a cheese spreader or a butter knife to spread frosting on the cooled cookies.  Serve the cookies with a glass of cold milk.
